definition: to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
illness/CL:場|场[chang2]/disease/to fall ill/defect
(negative prefix)/not/no

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Frightened by that, he felt ill right after returning home.
sentences.chinese: 他被嚇壞了，回到家後，便一病不起。

sentences.english: The scholar is subjected to this stroke, a disease not.
sentences.chinese: 書生受此打擊，一病不起。

sentences.english: He soon after and did not recover.
sentences.chinese: 不久後他就病倒了，而且一病不起。

sentences.english: Subjecting the student strikes, which he never recovered.
sentences.chinese: 書生受此打擊，一病不起。

sentences.english: I am very pleased, would rather that vulnerable state.
sentences.chinese: 我很欣慰，寧願就那樣一病不起的狀態。

ill in bed/bed-ridden
